articles.author: Kiley McDaniel
articles.title: Druw Jones suffers shoulder injury days after signing with Arizona Diamondbacks
articles.description: It wasn't immediately clear how serious the injury is, but D-backs prospect Druw Jones would miss the rest of the season if it required surgery.
articles.content:
Druw Jones, the second overall pick in this month's MLB draft, injured his shoulder Monday during his first batting practice with the Arizona Diamondbacks organization, the team said. 
It wasn't imm… [+1544 chars]

articles.title: Longtime Iowa coach Kirk Ferentz says college football 'in a really precarious place,' requires oversight from one stabilizing voice

articles.title: Julio Jones signing deal with Tampa Bay Buccaneers, source says
articles.description: Seven-time Pro Bowler Julio Jones is signing a one-year deal with the Buccaneers, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.
articles.content:
Veteran receiver Julio Jones has a new home, agreeing to a one-year deal with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Tuesday.
The seven-time Pro Bowler gives soon-to-be 45-y… [+1412 chars]

articles.title: Jerry Jones says Dallas Cowboys 'need to be viable' in playoffs for it be successful season
articles.description: Cowboys owner and general manager Jerry Jones said Tuesday his team needs to be 'viable in the playoffs' for him to consider it a successful season.
articles.content: OXNARD, Calif. -- Dallas Cowboys owner and general manager Jerry Jones turns 80 in October. Jones' team has gone 26 seasons without a Super Bowl and he expresses an urgency when he meets with coaches… [+3979 chars]

articles.author: Stephen Holder
articles.title: Indianapolis Colts LB Darius Leonard wants to go by middle name Shaquille
articles.description: Colts linebacker Darius Leonard said he wants to be known by his middle name Shaquille. "I would love if y'all would try to call me Shaquille or 'D' or 'Maniac' and not Darius," Leonard said.
articles.content:
WESTFIELD, Ind. -- The name Darius Leonard has become synonymous with defensive playmaking in the NFL.
But the Indianapolis Colts All-Pro linebacker no longer wants to be referred to by that name.
